page.title: 15Sport and Leisure
page.content: On the site of an old brickyard Cawood Park caravan site has facilities for caravans and tents and also has brick built chalets for holiday makers. The water filled clay pit is stocked with fish to provide sport. With a small fairground for children, bars with nightly entertainment for adults it attracts holiday makers from a wide area. It is open from April to November. { There is good fishing on the rivers {Wharfe and Ouse. Borrow pits made {during the construction of the nearby {floodbank in 1982 form the Northingale {Fish Ponds. Fish caught include eels, {pike, dace, dabb, and chubb. The private White Cross Powerboat Club has its headquarters at Cawood on the Ouse, and water ski-ing takes place upstream from Cawood.
